details.formulaStrippedArticleTitle: Parametric detector in the situation of mismatched signals
details.title: Parametric detector in the situation of mismatched signals
details.standardTitle: Parametric detector in the situation of mismatched signals
details.abstract: This study deals with the problem of adaptive detection in the presence of signal mismatch. An effective parametric detector is proposed, which encompasses Kelly's generalised likelihood ratio test (GLRT), adaptive matched filter (AMF) and adaptive beamformer orthogonal rejection test (ABORT) as its three special cases. The novel detector can control the degree to which the mismatched signals are rejected. A remarkable feature is that the novel detector can achieve slightly higher probability of detection, for matched signals than those of Kelly's GLRT, AMF and ABORT. Furthermore, it can also provide both improved robustness to the mismatched signals and enhanced rejection of the mismatched signals than its natural competitors.

ieee.displayText: Weijian Liu, Wenchong Xie, Jun Liu, Yongliang Wang, "Adaptive Double Subspace Signal Detection in Gaussian Background—Part I: Homogeneous Environments", Signal Processing IEEE Transactions on, vol. 62, pp. 2345-2357, 2014, ISSN 1053-587X.
ieee.title: Adaptive Double Subspace Signal Detection in Gaussian Background—Part I: Homogeneous Environments

ieee.title: Adaptive detection without training data in colocated MIMO radar

ieee.title: Knowledge-Based Adaptive Detection: Joint Exploitation of Clutter and System Symmetry Properties
